intro: Dorstenia mundamensis, commonly known as the African mountain fig, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves that often have a waxy coating. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, which later develop into edible, fig-like fruits. Dorstenia mundamensis is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as mountain forests and rocky slopes. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some traditional medicinal uses in local communities.
